title: Structural diversity and oligomerization of bacterial ubiquitin-like proteins.
authors: Gong M, Ye Q, Gu Y, Chambers LR, Bobkov AA, Arakawa NK, Matyszewski M, Corbett KD
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
abstract: Bacteria possess a variety of operons with homology to eukaryotic ubiquitination pathways that encode predicted E1, E2, E3, deubiquitinase, and ubiquitin-like proteins. Some of these pathways have recently been shown to function in anti-bacteriophage immunity, but the biological functions of others remain unknown. Here, we show that ubiquitin-like proteins in two bacterial operon families show surprising architectural diversity, possessing one to three β-grasp domains preceded by diverse N-terminal domains.
